content.description: Start at the bottom of the undercling seam as far right as possible. Traverse left, figure out how to get your feet up, then climb the steep slab up and left to top out. Using the aréte or the juggy crack on the aréte is off-limits, that's Cool Down V0. Only underclings and edges near the top. A little harder than Cellar Door V3
content.location: The bottom left side of the Fridge boulder when you approach it. You'll see some sharp underclings.

content.description: The mini arete on the obvious boulder about 30 feet to the northeast of the Fridge.  A one-move wonder, but it involves a fun dynamic move, so it's worth it.  Starts sitting, with the left on the obvious good diagonal, and the right on a small crimp.  Paste your feet somewhere under the roof (yes, the boulder on the ground is off) and go straight up to the good edge.  Immediately to the left is a fun v3 dyno, throwing from good sidepulls and shit feet to the top.
Start seated just right of Timeline on a pretty good rail. Traverse out and right up a crack system. Tricky topout. Named for my grandfather.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, landing is sloped.
content.location: Approach as for The Fridge. Follow trail; the large, obvious boulder is located about 100 yards uphill from The Fridge.

content.description: Grab the crimps, put your feet on the biggest little things you can find, and throw to the jug rail!  Fun single move problem.
content.location: This problem is on the left side of a little boulder set back about fifty feet from the Fridge.

content.description: Climb the obvious slab as you approach!
The left arete of this boulder, on the same face as the other two Fridge problems, is climbed using some bad-looking slopers.
content.location: on the same face as the other Fridge problems

content.description: A great slab footwork and balance exercise. A little heady topout makes this and its variation a thrill.
content.location: East side of the fridge, just to the right of the obvious Fridge Slab. Climb up the gradually steepening face to the climber's right and topout! Or do its V1 variation and start climber's left and work up the smooth arete.

content.description: Obvious problem left of the fridge arete.  Pick your choice of chalked head high holds and move a past a pinch and a layaway to a bulge.  Pass the bulge to a jug and an easy topout.
content.protection: a pad is nice but the landing is flat and safe without

content.description: This variation is in the Sheridan guidebook and starts as for Fridge Center making a very span-dependent move out right to the large pinch on the Fridge Arête from the large diagonal edge of Fridge Center. Continue to move up and top out as for Fridge Right. If you can make the span, you won’t regret figuring the rest out. Video in comments otherwise.
content.location: Start Fridge center. Move to diagonal rail. End Fridge right.

content.description: Climb the obvious steep arete of the Fridge boulder, using slopers, pinches and body tension.  Finishes with a really fun toss to a knob and a rockover up high.
content.protection: 2 pads are nice.  The throw to the knob is a little heady, but the landing is fine.
content.location: It is the obvious, overhanging arete on the NW side of the boulder.

content.description: Climb up and left on good feet and using the crack. Mantle when convenient and scramble to the top. This is also the standard descent.
content.location: Begins on the southwest aspect (climber's left as you approach) of the boulder up the obvious crack feature. This is also the standard downclimb.

content.description: Start left hand on the arete and right hand on a crimp. Paste your feet on and stand up for a matchable crimp feature. Match or bump off the crimp feature to a shallow dish/sloper. Bring your feet up and top out!
content.location: Just right around the arete from Fridge Right, or climber's left from the start of Cool Down.
